page.title: 18700th ANNIVERSERY PROCESSION
page.content: According to the First Book of High Wycombe the{first Mayor}was Roger Outred in 1285. Until 1485 a mayor has held the office for two to three years. Now he is elected annually. On 30th June 1985, a{procession}took place to celebrate{the 700 years of {the Mayorality}in High Wycombe. Among the many bands which attended were the Royal Marines and Majorettes who came from{Kelkheim,}High Wycombe's twin city in Germany. The procession left Mill End Road, two miles from the town centre at 2pm. On its arrival at the Rye,cups were awarded for the best non-commercial and commercial floats. The{beating of the bounds}used to be a local custom. It was brought back this year for the 700th anniversary. The processions proceed round the bounds of High Wycombe and a young boy is bounced to mark the spot.
